Looking for an Environmental Chemist professional who will be responsible for independent evaluation of third party environmental laboratory sample analysis results for compliance with method and QA/QC requirements.

The position is located at Fort Meade in Maryland.

You'll need to have or be able to obtain authorization for access to Fort Meade and U.S. Environmental Protection Agency facilities.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Review laboratory reported data according to EPA?s National Functional Guidelines for Data Validation or other procedures, as appropriate
  • Prepare written data validation reports using MS Word
  • Revise Electronic Data Deliverables (EDDs) using MS Excel - Review the reports and Excel spreadsheets of others Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree in chemistry, or equivalent - 8+ years of relevant experience including at least 3 years of analytical laboratory experience
  • Experience reviewing third party laboratory data
  • US Citizenship or Permanent Resident status
Preferred Skills/Experience:
  • Laboratory experience in important environmental, analytical instrumentation such as GC, GC/MS, ICP/AES, or ICP/MS
  • Experience in reviewing data from high resolution GS/MS techniques for dioxin/furans and/or PCB congener analysis
  • Experience in non-routine analyses such as explosives or radionuclides
  • Experience in validating data according to the EPA National Functional Guidelines
  • Experience working at DoD, EPA or other Federal facilities
Professional Skills:
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office suite of software
  • Team player with flexibility to meet a variety of fluctuating and varied client requirements
  • Strong quantitative skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and work under strict deadlines
